metadata.synopsis: Shadowheart is found crying for the first time in decades, reflecting on events in the Grotto. If her parents are still alive, they will come to comfort her.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Open origin debug book2. Night conditions3. Night - Daughter's Tears

23.speaker: Shadowheart
23.text: It doesn't look like anyone's been here in a while. Perhaps people lost faith. Or... forgot about it.
23.context:
CinematicNodeContext: SHADOWHEART stands in a quiet, overgrown city courtyard. In one corner is a statue of Selûne. She looks at it, wide-eyed.

The PLAYER approaches. Shadowheart nods towards the statue.

39.speaker: Shadowheart
39.text: I wanted to come here. To see if I felt anything that I hadn't done before. Now that I know what I know. Now that I know who I am.
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: She looks at the player directly.

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: I... I don't know. For so long I only felt what she wanted me to. Now I have to do it for myself, and I feel like I'm drowning.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Good thing I taught you how to swim, then.

126.speaker: Shadowheart
126.text: A very good thing. I don't know what I did to trick you into thinking I was worthy of you, but I'm glad it worked.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: You're putting too much pressure on yourself. Give it time.

105.speaker: Shadowheart
105.text: Shame. More than I ever knew it was possible to feel. Shar left me with all the memories I need to punish myself.

29.speaker: Shadowheart
29.text: I have my family back, and now I can't even look them in the eye. I don't deserve to be anyone's daughter.

97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks up to see her PARENTS approaching. ARNELL gives the player a Dad nod as he passes.

111.speaker: Shadowheart
111.text: I'm sorry. You shouldn't have to see me like this.

44.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
44.text: Alive? Free? Feeling? I've dreamt for years of seeing you like this.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Both parents approach Shadowheart. Emmeline cups Shadowheart's cheek, brushing a tear away.

117.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
117.text: Seeing you as yourself again, Jen. It kept us going, all this time.
117.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart breathes, the tears subsiding.

37.speaker: Shadowheart
37.text: I can't be your Jenevelle. Not as you remember her.
37.context: NodeContext: Steadying herself. Having a quiet epiphany.

58.speaker: Shadowheart
58.text: No. I'd be turning my back on too much. Shadowheart is as much a part of who I am as Jenevelle; I can't just forget her - that's not what I do anymore.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arnell and Emmeline exchange a sceptical look with one another towards the end of Shadowheart's line.

75.speaker: Shadowheart
75.text: Besides, Shadowheart still suits me - even better than before, perhaps. You can't cast a shadow without some light.

94.speaker: Shadowheart
94.text: Don't worry. I'm still your daughter... if you want me to be.

131.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
131.text: I'll call you whatever you like, so long as you're happy. Arnell?

13.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
13.text: The Moonmaiden guides, and helps us find our true selves, Shadowheart. Daughter.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arnell smiles and puts a hand on Shadowheart's shoulder. The player watches, pleased, then slips away, letting the reunited family enjoy their moment.

93.speaker: Shadowheart
93.text: Loss. Actual loss, not Shar's oblivion. I had my family, for too short a moment. Now they're gone. By my hand.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: They're not truly gone - remember the moon motes.

88.speaker: Shadowheart
88.text: I remember. But they can't comfort me. They can't give me advice. They can't tell me what I was like as a little girl.
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Verge of tearsNodeContext: Verge of tears

34.speaker: Player
34.text: You did what was necessary. You freed them, and yourself.

20.speaker: Shadowheart
20.text: But why does freedom have to feel like I've lost everything? Perhaps I could have saved them, or perhaps Shar would have helped me forget them. Instead, I've neither...
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Verge of tearsNodeContext: Verge of tears

31.speaker: Player
31.text: You made your choice - now you have to live with it.

2.speaker: Shadowheart
2.text: Perhaps not for long. The Absolute may yet put us out of our misery. I may see my parents again sooner than you think...
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Verge of tearsNodeContext: Verge of tears

82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart breaks down into gentle weeping.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: That's it, let it all out. This has been a long time coming.

19.speaker: Shadowheart
19.text: It's been a long time since I shed a tear. I don't even know how long.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart continues to cry another moment, then gathers herself.NodeContext: Gathering herself after crying

5.speaker: Shadowheart
5.text: We carry on - it's all we can do. I'll follow in a while, but I think I want to stay here a little longer, firstly. This place isn't familiar, but it's peaceful.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: So it's still Shadowheart, then? Sounds like you're not keen on Jenevelle.

101.speaker: Shadowheart
101.text: Shadowheart. She's as much a part of who I am as Jenevelle; I can't just forget her - that's not what I do anymore.

81.speaker: Shadowheart
81.text: Besides, Shadowheart still suits me - even better than before, perhaps. You can't cast a shadow without some light.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Small smileNodeContext: Spoken with a small smile. Reconciling the two parts of herself

107.speaker: Player
107.text: So what is it now - Shadowheart or Jenevelle?

102.speaker: Player
102.text: You've punished yourself enough. Let's head back.

106.speaker: Shadowheart
106.text: I'll follow. But I think I want to stay here a little longer, firstly. This place isn't familiar, but it's peaceful.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Dry your eyes. Until we've saved ourselves, tears are a luxury.

80.speaker: Shadowheart
80.text: All about the mission. You sound like how I used to sound. I'm all right now. Or... close enough, anyway.
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart continues to cry another moment, then gathers herself.NodeContext: Gathering herself after crying

55.speaker: Shadowheart
55.text: I'm all right now. Or... close enough, anyway.
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart continues to cry another moment, then gathers herself.NodeContext: Gathering herself after crying

87.speaker: Player
87.text: You've turned from Shar. Doesn't necessarily oblige you to come here and embrace Selûne.

70.speaker: Shadowheart
70.text: True. But too much freedom can be frightening... lonely. There's a reason why so many are eager to bow.

104.speaker: Shadowheart
104.text: I had my family, for too short a moment. Now they're gone. By my hand.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Who you are? You mean Jenevelle?

10.speaker: Shadowheart
10.text: That's a dead girl's name. I don't deserve it - I had to look up how it was spelled, for pity's sake.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: The Moonmaiden guides, but discreetly. Give it time.

67.speaker: Shadowheart
67.text: So much time's been lost already. Most of it, I can't even remember. And what I do remember... it would have been so much easier to just become a monster.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: As a traitor to your goddess, you should feel shame - shame and dread.

99.speaker: Shadowheart
99.text: You helped bring me to this point - you're as much a traitor as anyone. Besides, the betrayal was Shar's, not mine.

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *You stare up at the statue of Selûne. Her placid stone face was once that of the enemy, but no longer...*
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avatar SH gazes at the statue of Selune contemplatively.

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *Now you see a benevolent stranger. An unasked-for patron. And a guiding light for your parents.*
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avatar SH gazes at the statue of Selune contemplatively.

33.speaker: Narrator
33.text: *They're with her now. Thanks to you.*
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH bows her head solemnly.

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *While you are left behind, once again. You feel a lump rise in your throat.*

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Try to dampen emotion with reason. You barely knew them.

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *You cannot swallow your own lie. You knew them, and you miss them. Your vision blurs with hot tears...*

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Silently rebuke yourself. Weeping is what others do.

24.speaker: Narrator
24.text: *The old you may have believed that once, but no more. Your vision blurs with hot tears...*

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Offer a prayer for them - to Selûne.

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *You silently fumble for the right words. No doubt your parents could have guided you in what to say. Tears blur your eyes...*

59.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart breaks down into gentle weeping. After a few moments, she gathers herself, brushing her cheek with the back of her hand.

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *You realise you cannot remember when you last shed tears. Could it be possible that you never cried before?*
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Composed again, gazing at the statue.

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *All you know is you feel better for it - lighter. You know where you came from. You know you were loved. And where you go now is in your hands.*
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Composed, gazing at the statue.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: Tears are coming. Let them flow.

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *You succeeded, but at what cost? Your pain endures. Your past is lost - save for the very worst memories. How can your parents bear to even look at you, never mind love you?*

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *Parents. You rejected Shar for these strangers you share blood with, but you also did terrible things to them. And yet, they profess to love you all the same.*

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *Shame, joy, regret, relief, and a host of other emotions jostle for your attention. It's too much. You feel hot tears flood your eyes.*

50.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arnell speaks softly off-screen. SH looks up, face tear-streaked.

49.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
49.text: My darling girl. The last time I saw you cry, you cut your knee while chasing a frog.
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Emmeline and Arnell approach Shadowheart. Emmeline gently brushes the tears from Shadowheart's cheek with her right hand.NodeContext: Soothing.

128.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
128.text: And we're not going anywhere, Jenevelle.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: I don't deserve you. Not after all I did to you.

71.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
71.text: Banish those thoughts. You deserve a lifetime of happiness that was taken from you. Now we have to make up for lost time.
71.context: NodeContext: reassuring, but with a firm, motherly edge. 'no more silly talk'

66.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
66.text: Your mother's right, Jen. We're here for you.

91.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
91.text: Wait, Arnell. Don't you see? She's not a little girl anymore. That name stays with the child. Our daughter is a woman who's lived a whole lifetime away from us, and her name is Shadowheart.
91.context: CinematicNodeContext: Studying Shadowheart with a knowing, motherly look while addressing ArnellNodeContext: 'A mother knows' almost uncanny insight

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Jenevelle... I can't be her. I'm sorry.

53.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
53.text: Wait, Arnell. Don't you see? Our daughter's not a little girl anymore. She's a woman - one who's lived a whole lifetime without us.
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Studying Shadowheart with a knowing, motherly look while addressing ArnellNodeContext: 'A mother knows' almost uncanny insight

61.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
61.text: Of course we do. We're two halves of you. And we'll love you all the same, no matter what you're called. Arnell?
61.context: NodeContext: Understanding. Slight questioning tone on 'Arnell?' to ensure her husband is of a similar mind

95.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
95.text: Your mother's right - she always is. Do not bend to the past. Look only to the future - on your own terms.
95.context: NodeContext: Moment of realisation and acceptance. His daughter isn't exactly as he remembers her, and that's okay

90.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
90.text: Shadowheart. Our daughter. It suits you.

92.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
92.text: Of course. It speaks to both sides of you. After all, you cannot cast a shadow without some light.

122.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart's eyes start to well up with tears again - but happy ones. She reaches for her parents in an embrace.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I've known some who'd argue with you on that...

108.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
108.text: You point them towards me - I'll sort their bacon in no time.

47.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
47.text: Hush dear, we've had enough excitement to last a good while...

14.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
14.text: But yes, Shadowheart. It speaks to both sides of you. After all, you cannot cast a shadow without some light.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: It's what I'm used to, that's all.

115.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
115.text: It's more than that. It speaks to both sides of you. After all, you cannot cast a shadow without some light.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Perhaps I can try. Perhaps I can get used to the name.

77.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
77.text: No. Your mother's right - she always is. Do not bend to the past. Look only to the future - on your own terms.
77.context: NodeContext: Moment of realisation and acceptance. His daughter isn't exactly as he remembers her, and that's okay

112.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
112.text: No, Jen. That's what they called you - forced on you.
112.context: NodeContext: Some alarm, like his daughter is experiencing Stockholm syndrome
